poem:
Title: "In Transit Laments"

From North to South, East to West,
Upon iron veins of progress, we're unduly stressed.
Avanti! Avanti! But no one's at the helm,
In the fervor for progress, workers feel overwhelmed.
Only 3% find valor in their stride,
While delays and cancellations persist, amplified.
Whence we seek for swift, for mere velocity,
Let's not forget the heart at the core of capacity.
